pr_title: Add new signature based function registry

timeline.message:
WIP: refactor function registration and resolving

 - [x] Support function overloading
 - [] Support iteration over registered function incl. all info’s required by `pg_proc`
 - [x] Use type precendence and cast if needed
 - [] Move (down-)cast lucene optimization to a rule

timeline.bodyText: I think we output this in information_schema tables, so this may be a breaking change. If we do need to change it, maybe we  could go with innerType.getName() + '[]' for improved PostgreSQL compatibility?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText:
I think we should change it as parsing a E_array (for declaring generic array type signatures) may be error prone, and also it is not good human readable IMO.
Totally agree that we should try to change it in the right direction, will try to implement it using E[].
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText: Once you've confirmed that E[] works, could we extract the change into a dedicated PR?
replies.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: Or maybe we split this into internalName() / externalName() and defer the breaking change to 5.0?
replies.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: I've just figured out that we don't need to change that as I've handling array signature resolving in concrete way anyway already. So changing this representation would be out of scope for the new signature binding.
replies.author: seut

timeline.bodyText: What do you think of going for module.register(signature, types -> impl), and omit the FuncResolver from the register API?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: You mean to create a FuncResolver instance only internally? Sure good point, we just need this class internally for the resolving anyway.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText:
You mean to create a FuncResolver instance only internally?

yes
replies.author: mfussenegger

timeline.message: fixup! WIP: refactor function registration and resolving
fixup! WIP: refactor function registration and resolving

WIP: refactor function registration and resolving

 - [x] Support function overloading
 - [x] Use type precendence and cast if needed

timeline.bodyText:
This is not really correct, depending on the argument types it will change to object(text, V, text, V2, ...) where V and V2 may be bound to different types.
Currently the return type is not used so it won't matter, but will be later used for information of all registered functions (pg_proc).
Not sure, shall we define it as object() (undefined inner types)? We could also discuss/change it when adding the signature information to pg_proc.
timeline.author: seut

replies.bodyText: Not sure how to deal with this, but maybe meanwhile add a comment inline to point this out.
replies.author: mfussenegger

diff --git a/sql/src/main/java/io/crate/expression/scalar/arithmetic/MapFunction.java b/sql/src/main/java/io/crate/expression/scalar/arithmetic/MapFunction.java
index 06a6df89e1..7c39f47bbe 100644
--- a/sql/src/main/java/io/crate/expression/scalar/arithmetic/MapFunction.java
+++ b/sql/src/main/java/io/crate/expression/scalar/arithmetic/MapFunction.java

@@ -85,6 +85,9 @@ public class MapFunction extends Scalar<Object, Object> {
                 .kind(FunctionInfo.Type.SCALAR)
                 .typeVariableConstraints(List.of(typeVariableOfAnyType("V")))
                 .argumentTypes(parseTypeSignature("text"), parseTypeSignature("V"))
+                // This is not 100% correct because each variadic `V` is type independent, resulting in a return type
+                // of e.g. `object(text, int, text, geo_point, ...)`.
+                // This is *ok* as the returnType is currently not used directly, only for function description.
                 .returnType(parseTypeSignature("object(text, V)"))
                 .variableArityGroup(List.of(parseTypeSignature("text"), parseTypeSignature("V")))
                 .build(),

timeline.message:
WIP: refactor function registration and resolving

 - [x] Support function overloading
 - [x] Use type precendence and cast if needed

Implement new signature based function registry

Signatures can be defined with type variables constraints to support
constraints across given argument types, e.g. a `array(E), array(E)`
signature requires all `E` types to either have a common super type or 
being convertible.
Special logic of literal downcasts (avoid table-scans) is omitted, 
this should be re-implemented decoupled later on.

Each function can be registered with different signatures (function overloading).
The registry can be iterated to get all registered signatures.

timeline.bodyText: Would it make sense to have this method in TypeSignature ? signature.createType() or something like that?

timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.message:
Implement new signature based function registry

Signatures can be defined with type variables constraints to support
constraints across given argument types, e.g. a `array(E), array(E)`
signature requires all `E` types to either have a common super type or
being convertible.
Special logic of literal downcasts (avoid table-scans) is omitted,
this should be re-implemented decoupled later on.

Each function can be registered with different signatures (function overloading).
The registry can be iterated to get all registered signatures.

being convertible.
Special logic of literal downcasts (avoid table-scans) is omitted,
this should be re-implemented decoupled later on.

Each function can be registered with different signatures (function overloading).
The registry can be iterated to get all registered signatures.

Signatures can be defined with type variables constraints to support
constraints across given argument types, e.g. a `array(E), array(E)`
signature requires all `E` types to either have a common super type or
being convertible.
Special logic of literal downcasts (avoid table-scans) is omitted,
this should be re-implemented decoupled later on.

Each function can be registered with different signatures (function overloading).
The registry can be iterated to get all registered signatures.
